abstract: New rules on earnings reporting makes valuing Goldman a bit easier than it once was.
snippet: New rules on earnings reporting makes valuing Goldman a bit easier than it once was.
lead_paragraph: Public opprobrium played a hand in Goldman Sachs’s decision to disclose more about its trading and investments for its own account, the first fruits of which emerged in a regulatory filing on Tuesday. But the Wall Street firm’s reorganization of how it reports earnings also serves its own purposes. It makes valuing the firm a bit easier by enabling a better sum-of-the-parts analysis than was previously possible.

headline.main: Adding Up Parts at Goldman Sachs
headline.print_headline: Adding Up Parts At Goldman Sachs

byline.original: By ANTONY CURRIE and ROBERT CYRAN
